title: Can science and magic coexist? Insights on the limitations of magic and the concept of pure freedom.
first_phrase: The last part of this text explores the boundary between positive science and magic. It argues that while some events may appear to be magical, they can potentially have a natural explanation that science has not yet discovered. The text references the story of Milarepa and Khwaja Nizam-ud-din-Aulia to illustrate this point. In these instances, what appeared to be magic had a rational explanation that was not immediately apparent. The text also highlights the different approaches that "Bruto", "Vai", and "Nir" take to reconcile determinism and spiritual freedom.

last_phrase: In conclusion, while the concept of pure freedom may be difficult to grasp and may not align with traditional esoteric teachings, the idea of conditioned magic does not necessarily contradict natural determinism. By limiting the scope of freedom in favor of determinism, we may better understand and explain certain phenomena, but it is important to recognize the limitations of this approach and the relative nature of freedom in social and moral contexts.
